com.salesforce.omakase.ast

Class CssAnnotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.omakase.ast.CssAnnotation

  • public final class CssAnnotation
extends Object
    Represents a CSS annotation comment.

    CSS comment annotations are CSS comments that contain an annotation in the format of "@annotationName [optionalArgs]", for example "@noparse", "@browser ie7", "@something arg1 arg2 arg3", etc...

    There are methods to support various types of arg formats, including space-separated, comma-separated and enum-based. More complex, custom formats can manually be parsed via the rawArgs() method.

    Syntax units are associated with the CSS comments that directly precede them. More than one CSS annotation comment is allowed. See the main readme for more information on comments.

      • spaceSeparatedArgs

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<String> spaceSeparatedArgs()
        Parses the arguments using spaces as the delimiter. Results will be trimmed and will not contain any empty strings.

        For example, given the following css annotation: 

        
      @foo one two three four
        The arguments returned will be a list with values "one", "two", "three", and "four".
        Returns:
        The parsed list of arguments, or an empty list if no arguments are present.

      • commaSeparatedArgs

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<String> commaSeparatedArgs()
        Parses the arguments using commas as the delimiter. Results will be trimmed and will not contain any empty strings.

        For example, given the following css annotation: 

        
      @foo one, two, three, four
        The arguments returned will be a list with values "one", "two", "three", and "four".
        Returns:
        The parsed list of arguments, or an empty list if no arguments are present.

      • keyValueArgs

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<String,String> keyValueArgs(char keyValueSeparator)
        Parsers the arguments for key value pairs. Results will be trimmed and will not contain any empty strings.

        The key value pairs are separated by commas. For example, given any of the following css annotations: 

        
      @foo bar=baz, bim=bop, bip=beep
      @foo bar = baz, bim = bop, bip = beep
      @foo bar:baz, bim:bop, bip:beep
      @foo bar baz, bim bop, bip beep
        The arguments returned will be a map with values {"bar"="baz", "bim"="bop", "bip"="beep"}.

        Optionally, the first arg may omit the key, and it will be placed in the map under "name". For example: 

        
      @foo bar, bim bop, bip beep
        The arguments returned will be a map with values {"name"="bar", "bim"="bop", "bip"="boop"}
        Parameters:
        keyValueSeparator - The character separating key-value pairs, usually ' ', '=' or ':'. Spaces around this character are allowed.
        Returns:
        The parsed map of arguments, or an empty map if no arguments are present.

      • fromEnum

        public <E extends Enum<E>> EnumSet<E> fromEnum(Class<E> enumClass)
        Same as fromEnum(Class, CaseFormat, CaseFormat), except this method only works with enums that use TITLE_CASE, and annotations that either use TITLE_CASE or lowerCamel.
        Type Parameters:
        E - The enum type.
        Parameters:
        enumClass - The enum class.
        Returns:
        The set of enum values found, or an empty set if no arguments are present.

      • fromEnum

        public <E extends Enum<E>> EnumSet<E> fromEnum(Class<E> enumClass,
                                               com.google.common.base.CaseFormat enumFormat,
                                               com.google.common.base.CaseFormat annotationFormat)
        Parses the arguments with allowed values from the given enum.

        The values must be space-separated and any value not present in the enum will result in an error. For example, with the enum {ONE, TWO, THREE}, the following: 

        
      @foo one two
        would return a map containing ONE and TWO.

        The names must be an exact match, however they will be normalized using the given CaseFormats.

        Type Parameters:
        E - The enum type.
        Parameters:
        enumClass - The enum class.
        enumFormat - The format of the enum.
        annotationFormat - The format used by the css annotations.
        Returns:
        The set of enum values found, or an empty set if no arguments are present.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - for annotation arguments without a matching enum entry.

      • toComment

        public Comment toComment(boolean useCached)
        Creates a new Comment instance using this annotation as the content.
        Parameters:
        useCached - If true, this method will reuse the same Comment instance previously created from this method instead of creating a new one. As Comment objects are essentially immutable, you usually want to pass true here.
        Returns:
        The new Comment instance.
